results.title: Drinking driving: Danger level
results.brief_description: Examines the effect of alcohol on driving performance. Scientific tests were carried out at Warwick Farm motor racing circuit, using drivers given carefully measured quantities of alcohol. From the results of these experiments, a danger level of alcohol consumption was able to be ascertained.

results.title: Drinking-driving. Edited version
results.creator_credit: Christopher Productions, Ansvar Insurance and Warren J Mills
results.brief_description: An experiment conducted by the University of New South Wales shows that the intake of alcohol has a detrimental effect on the driving performance of both the ordinary motorist and the skilled racing driver. Shows both drivers tackling a course before drinking, and then at blood-alcohol levels of .05 and .08.

results.title: Drinking
results.creator_credit: Floyd Elliott, ONF | NFB and Joe Licastro
results.brief_description: By alternating live-action sequences and animated graphics, the film follows the behavioral and physiological transformations that are directly linked to consumption of alcohol. It shows the short-term and long-term effects on the human body.

results.title: Drink-driving education
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Education, Peter Johnson, Peter Skolinick, Greg Reading, Jan Sharp and Tom Chen
results.brief_description: A compilation of “Drinking, driving, surviving”, “Saturday night again” and “The Thirsty season”. Covers physiological effects of alcohol; the social context and advertising.

results.title: Drills and drilling safety
results.brief_description: This video looks at the use of various types of drills, such as cordless and power drills, and also drill bits and accessories. It shows how to safely drill into metal, masonry and ceramics.

results.title: Drilling a hole in a pin
results.brief_description: Shows the operation and sequences followed when drilling a hole in each end of a steel pin. Two methods are shown: drilling a layout, and drilling with a jig. Explains the reasons for each movement and emphasises various safety precautions.

results.title: Drifting in Antarctica
results.brief_description: Alice, a profoundly deaf Zoologist, tells of her experience as a volunteer seabird observer on a working icebreaker in Antarctica. Featuring excerpts from “The rime of the ancient mariner” by Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: Drifting
results.brief_description: Looks at the British herring-fishing, ports drift-fishers in port, and leaving for the fishing grounds. Shows in detail the process of catching the herring.

results.title: Drifters
results.creator_credit: Empire Marketing Board and John Grierson
results.brief_description: The only film ever directed personally by John Grierson. A documentary made for the Empire Marketing Board about the men of the British herring fleets. ‘Drifters’ brought to the screen the labour of the North Sea herring fleet in such a way that the ordinary man or woman was made to realise, perhaps for the first time, that the herring on his plate was no mere accident, but the result of the labour and courage of other men.
results.description: The only film ever directed personally by John Grierson. results.title: Dressing up in the past
results.creator_credit: David Ferris, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Presents Lorri Baines, National Gallery Education Officer, demonstrating what the gallery offers children in terms of the history of clothing and costume. Using two children as models she shows how eighteen century aristocrats would have dressed and the restrictions imposed by their mode of dress.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Ferris, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Jeff Spencer
